website_summaries.verdict: This basic bellows gets the job done for smaller indoor and outdoor fires.
pros: Leatherette detail and strap for hanging
Good for fireplaces, grills, and fire pits
cons: Gives a strong, focused burst of air, which sometimes can put out small, struggling flames

customer_reviews.title: Smoke in your eyes?
customer_reviews.text: Eyes wide open and let's talk fireplace or woodstove bellows. We wanted one, we searched, we read reviews and we tried to make a good choice. The item pictured looks attractive, sturdy and functional plus made of wood. Abject failure on three of four qualifiers. The positive? It is made of wood. As is the box it came in. This bellows is composed of highly compressed thin sheets of paper. Layers and layers of paper with a slick thicker plastic handle cover with woodgrain look. The leatherette was not awful and the rivets were sturdy. Compressed paper was not on our wish list. Item returned to Amazon. May have to take up woodworking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for precise control of airflow to fire.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for the "fanning cardboard" in order to get air in my fireplace for my fire. This tool provides precise control with the amount of air in the bellows much better that the fanning carboard which sometimes can put a fire out. The quality of the product is ok, if it were more expensive I would be more annoyed about it, but it serves a great value. I would highly recommend this product for anyone who is serious about campfires.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: it was a very good price and it does work
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected which means is has a short stroke. You will have to pump this a lot to get much air movement. However, it was a very good price and it does work. Also, it fits in my utility drawer due to the smaller size, which I guess is a good thing. Certainly wouldn't work for pumping a forge, but for the occasional fire, it'll do.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Functional.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item because the particleboard was showing through on the little hole on the side. I should have looked at the description more closely to see that it was made of particle board. I want an actual wood yellow and this...Well it wasn’t that expensive and it does work. But it is not to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Lanie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for my charcoal grill for a year now, and it's held up well. It's infinitely better than fanning with a piece of cardboard and I've gotten fires hotter than I ever could without it. The construction material looks cheap but a year later, it still works great. My only complaint is that the air is a little too focused, meaning you get a strong, quick burst of air in one small spot, which sometimes puts out a fire instead of stoking it. I think a slightly broader nozzle would be preferable.
customer_reviews.author: Gelfling

customer_reviews.title: Blows good
customer_reviews.text: No more using a ceiling fan to get my Woodstove going. No more using my mouth. But alas I will miss using the fan and proclaiming “old Indian trick” as I do so. I also will miss the sarcasm of claiming I can really blow hard and good. Good enough to get ones fire burning. Maybe this wasn’t such a good idea? Either way it works well!! And is made well.
customer_reviews.author: Regina R.

customer_reviews.title: Save your back and lungs, get this for grilling and camping!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for outdoor grilling and campfires in the backyard, it was the least expensive one I could find that also looked like it would not fall apart after use. So far, it is holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: An Ever-Fixed Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good, bargain-priced bellows
customer_reviews.text: Could be a bit bigger. The wood is probably a composite (sawdust and glue). There is a paper vernier with wood grain. It was peeling a bit around the inlet hole and the edges were a bit curly. The tip is painted metal. It will work for starting fires this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C.

customer_reviews.title: useful, cheap lanyard
customer_reviews.text: works really well actually. Its not real wood or anything, and the lanyard is a cheap pleather material so I took it off and put a real leather loop on it. Its one of those old fashion items that actually serves a purpose and mine is going strong after a long time of use.
customer_reviews.author: rmc890

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor fireplace
customer_reviews.text: + Looks great, fits right in with a rustic fireplace + Very durable + Puts out a LOT of air, very effective for helping start/maintain the fire - A bit expensive, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Decent bellow, but not life altering
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little bellows. It looks classy sitting next to the fireplace, and it blows well enough, particularly for a relatively small device. Personally though, I find that simply getting close to the fire and blowing works the best. I've operated this way since I was a child, and this bellow hasn't changed that opinion. So, solid device, but if you have been building fires your whole life by blowing on them, this won't change your mind.
customer_reviews.author: Haon the GreatTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my partner for Christmas. She maintains the fireplace in our house. It’s small and easy to use. The strap is perfect, we hang it right on the rack we have for our fireplace tools. Easier to maintain a nice blazer in winter!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: a great added tool as well as design for my fireplace this winter helps keep the fires live late in the house warm without killing myself trying to keep the fire breathing
customer_reviews.author: brad s pinyon

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how much air this unit would put out, and I was pleasantly surprised at how well it works. No more huffing and puffing the keep a fire going.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone that has a fireplace (and uses it) should own one of these. They make fire flame maintenance so much easier. Purchased a few of these for gifts too. And everyone loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Waist of money
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheaply made hunk of crap. Not what i expected for the reviews. This seems like it is made as a decorative piece amd not intended for use. Ill keep using lung power until i find a real one.
customer_reviews.author: ZHamp

customer_reviews.title: Looks expensive and heavy, but light and functional
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged, but tip was nonetheless bent. Still works and I am eagerly awaiting a nice fall evening. Nicely constructed, light -weight. I think it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good looking piece especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good looking piece especially for the price. It will also push a lot of air and get a fire raging in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: that thing blows.
customer_reviews.text: no literally, that's all it does. I do not recommend using it to blow candles, it's pretty powerful. doesn't work to pump your tires either. but for a fireplace, a barbecue or a firepit. 'tis the bee's knees.
customer_reviews.author: Ludivine

customer_reviews.title: Good job
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Cuts down on the hassle of building a fire in a wood heater. Great investment for our first one.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Good to buy - prob not lifelong lasting
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality but it does the job it was intended for. Also good at keeping the pets away from my food.
customer_reviews.author: Cersei L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bellow
customer_reviews.text: Great little bellow for the money. I wish the strap held it together when it’s hanging not in use but it does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle N.

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping
customer_reviews.text: I got this to get camp fires going a little faster and works very good. It is a bit small in the hands but does what it needs to.
customer_reviews.author: Foamy

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Way to small for a fireplace. I can blow the same strength but it was what they said it was.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN RUTHERFORD

customer_reviews.title: so it is the perfect size for my use
customer_reviews.text: I will be using this for a fire pit, so it is the perfect size for my use. It is not real wood or leather, but for the price, I was not expecting that. It works perfectly and suits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Gentzler

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson who is a Young Marine and responsible for making the fire in the outside firpit. They had it for less than two months when the tacs holding the material in began to pull out. Not much longer, after pushing the tacs back in numberous times, it ‘not the dust’. I feel like I just wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille C.

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give my son a bellows for his fireplace. I have been using one for years. It is a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: dobiegirls

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It was a little cheap looking on close inspection, but you couldn't tell from a distance. Worked super well, I stopped getting super dizzy from huffing and puffing on the fire, so, that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Does the job
customer_reviews.text: They don't seem super sturdy but so far, I haven't broken them. They do the job that was meant so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Starfishgirl

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty with our fireplace tools
customer_reviews.text: bought this to save my husband from asphyxiating as he stoked our fire both outside and inside. He's alive, so this obviously works. Looks pretty with our fireplace tools.
customer_reviews.author: G. Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Companies don't care about quality, they just want to rob you of your hard earned money.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap flimsy piece of garbage. Be careful not to drop it or let it get even remotely warm. Made of particle board and crumbles around the edges. Plastic not leather. Not a very good seal, air leaks around the entire thing. The nozzle is very thin stamped metal, not sturdy thick brass. This thing us useless, lasted 6 days before I gave up and threw it in the wood stove.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had a bigger one, but that was my fault. This is well made and does the job well. Worth the $$$

customer_reviews.title: Good for small fireplace.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but it is small and the air is pointed in a very pointed, small direction so it can blow out a small flame.
customer_reviews.author: kb

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was thinking this might be too small to use for camp fires but it works perfect! Have been using this for a couple months now and it works great!

customer_reviews.title: Time saver!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has helped us get our fires going so much better. I don't know how we managed getting our fires going the two years previous to purchasing this!

customer_reviews.title: Helps the fire to blaze 🔥.
customer_reviews.text: We have used it several times and it works great.

customer_reviews.title: It works great, even though smaller than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The measurements are close to as listed, but a 15.355 inch bellows is actually medium-small. The materials are good. Most important, it works well to perk up the fire or get it started.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t wait to use

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, adequate construction, should last several seasons of use.

customer_reviews.title: Wood Bellow

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made but works

customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected, but works great! We have daily fires as it is our heat source. Have had this for 2 years now & no problems. Don't know why such bad reviews?

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend this product for easy
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend this product for easy, indoor use...which is what we purchased it for. Gets the job done on a small indoor fireplace fire and looks nice hanging on the hearth. Not sure that it would hold up outdoors in the elements for very long, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Form meets function
customer_reviews.text: Well-made and a great side to keep by the fireplace or fire-pit. I'll also take them camping with me, too. Not only functional, they make for some nice home decor hanging on the wall.

customer_reviews.title: Find another if you don't want to throw your money in the garbage.
customer_reviews.text: It's junk. The tacks are coming out and the leather has tears after just three or so uses. Find another if you don't want to throw your money in the garbage.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: Blows Good

customer_reviews.title: Good product

customer_reviews.title: Good.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars

customer_reviews.title: I suppose ya' get what ya' pay for....
customer_reviews.text: The Tosnail Bellows serves it's purpose but could be better. It injects a stream of air into the fireplace thus stoking the fire. However, Tosnail could make a better product. The materials are cheap & the thin metal tip is sturdy like a sheet of aluminum foil. The bellows are cheap vinyl & the carry strap looks like leftover vinyl scraps they picked-up off the shop floor. The good news is the price is relatively cheap but I'd rather pay slightly more for better quality. I'd be embarrassed to give this as a gift to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bshops2much!

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good value but had a small tear in it when it arrived.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My two and four year old nephews loved it. It was for their Dad!

customer_reviews.title: great product and build quality
customer_reviews.text: great product and build quality. use it often on our outdoor fire pit or getting coals prepped in our grill.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken!!!!!!! Now I have to take it to the post office and pay to ship it back! So mad!!!

customer_reviews.text: Really inexpensive, but that is what I wanted. Use it to build heat in an outdoor smoker. Beats using a hair dryer and extension cord.

product_meta.title: Tosnail Wood Bellows, Fireplace Bellows 15.5" x 6.5", Wood Bellows, Brown Color
